highlights: Hopper compute + InfiniBand networking core to AI factories; 40% revenue now inference
H200 ramping (HBM3e) and TensorRT LLM doubling inference performance
Spectrum-X Ethernet launch, Quantum InfiniBand 5x growth, DGX Cloud expanding to AWS

notes: GeForce RTX 40 SUPER series, DLSS 3.5 Ray Reconstruction, TensorRT-LLM for Windows, RTX AI PCs
Omniverse adoption by Mercedes-Benz, RTX 2000 Ada for AI workloads, vehicle configurators
Drive Orin traction and new DRIVE Thor partnership with Foxconn; AI cockpit solutions ramping

capital_expenditure.context: Includes capex and intangibles to expand AI compute/data center infrastructure

capital_return.note: Returned $2.8B in Q4; $9.9B in FY24 to shareholders

data_center: Record $18.4B data center revenue; 47.5B FY24, 40% inference mix, sovereign AI expansions
H200 and Spectrum-X, TensorRT-LLM, DGX Cloud on AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google, Oracle collaborations
software_services: $1B annualized run rate for NVIDIA AI Enterprise, software growing with partners such as Adobe, ServiceNow, SAP
AI Foundry for custom copilots, BioNeMo for biotech, MONAI cloud APIs for healthcare
innovation: Hopper GPU & InfiniBand as AI factory standard; Spectrum-X Ethernet and Quantum InfiniBand fueling networking

metadata.source: NVDA Q4 FY2024 press release & transcript
